oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pamphlets; Leaflets; Flags; Public Speaking; Meetings
Nashville (Tenn.); United Confederate Veterans; Young, Bennett Henderson, 1843-1919.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Twenty-three page address given by General Bennett Henderson Young at a United Confederate Veterans' Reunion in Mobile, Alabama, in 1910.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United Confederate Veterans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bennett H. Young (1843-1919) was a Confederate officer who led forces in the St. Albans Raid (1864), a military action during the Civil War. As a lieutenant of the Confederate Army, he entered Vermont from Canada and occupied the town of St. Albans. He later served as leader of the United Confederate Veterans organization.
